meanings.definition: To furnish or supply with something
meanings.sent1: I will plenish the room with new furniture.
meanings.sent2: She decided to plenish her wardrobe with trendy clothes.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to plenish the empty box with colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to plenish the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The chef worked tirelessly to plenish the buffet with delicious dishes.

meanings.definition: To fill or stock with goods
meanings.sent1: The store owner will plenish the shelves with fresh produce.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse manager needs to plenish the inventory before the holiday rush.
meanings.sent3: The pirates planned to plenish their ship with stolen treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to plenish his heart with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The gardener will plenish the garden with colorful flowers for the event.

meanings.definition: To provide with what is needed
meanings.sent1: The kind neighbor offered to plenish their pantry with groceries.
meanings.sent2: The organization aims to plenish the community with essential resources.
meanings.sent3: The fairy godmother used her magic to plenish Cinderella with a beautiful gown.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to plenish her soul with comfort.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will plenish the classroom with educational materials for the students.
